title: Force exerted on the floor by a bouncing ball

content.question: The graph shows the force exerted on a ball by the floor as a function of time as the ball bounces off the floor. If the positive direction is upward, which of the following graphs could represent the force exerted on the floor by the ball?

choices.label: The figure shows the graph of a curve in the coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time,” and the vertical axis is labeled “Force.” The curve begins at the origin, then moves horizontally to the right at first. The curve then moves steeply upward and to the right, reaching a peak about halfway along the horizontal axis, near the top of the vertical axis. The curve then moves steeply downward and to the right until it reaches the horizontal axis, and continues moving horizontally to the right.

The figure shows the graph of a curve in the coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time,” and the vertical axis is labeled “Force.” The curve begins above the origin along the vertical axis, and moves horizontally to the right at first. It then moves steeply downward and to the right until it touches the horizontal axis where it reaches a minimum about halfway along the axis. The curve then moves steeply upward and to the right until it is the same height as it had started, then continues moving horizontally to the right.

The figure shows the graph of a curve in the coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time,” and the vertical axis is labeled “Force.” The curve begins at the origin, then moves horizontally to the right at first. The curve then moves steeply downward and to the right, reaching a minimum about halfway along the horizontal axis, near the bottom of the vertical axis. The curve then moves steeply upward and to the right until it reaches the horizontal axis, and continues moving horizontally to the right.

The figure shows the graph of a curve in the coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time,” and the vertical axis is labeled “Force.” The curve begins below the origin along the vertical axis, and moves horizontally to the right at first. It then moves steeply upward and to the right until it touches the horizontal axis where it reaches a peak about halfway along the axis. The curve then moves steeply downward and to the right until it is the same height as it had started, then continues moving horizontally to the right.

content.answer: The figure shows the graph of a curve in the coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time,” and the vertical axis is labeled “Force.” The curve begins at the origin, then moves horizontally to the right at first. The curve then moves steeply downward and to the right, reaching a minimum about halfway along the horizontal axis, near the bottom of the vertical axis. The curve then moves steeply upward and to the right until it reaches the horizontal axis, and continues moving horizontally to the right.
